sentence.Network_en: It has been said that art is a tryst , for in the joy of it maker and beholder meet.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人说艺术是一种幽会, 因为艺术家和欣赏者可在幽会的乐趣中相遇在一起.

sentence.Network_en: Poor Mr Sanford didn't a chance of keeping his tryst secret.
sentence.Network_cn: 可怜的桑福德根本不可能会守住自己幽会的秘密.

sentence.Network_en: It's usually wise to leave your out - of - tryst where you found it.
sentence.Network_cn: 离开那些你能找到的外乡约会通常是明智的.

list.abs: one of the very first was paris hilton' s then boyfriend rick salomon , who in 2004 brought a night-vision tape of their tryst to red light district video .其中的第一是帕里斯希尔顿当时的男友里克萨洛蒙，在2004年带来了他们在红灯区幽会的夜视录影带视频。

a clandestine tryst ;, 偷偷的私下约会.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (originally Scots): variant of obsolete trist 'an appointed place in hunting', from French triste or medieval Latin trista

entry.def: A tryst is a meeting between lovers in a quiet secret place.

means.word_mean: 1. a date; usually with a member of the opposite sex

auth_sentence.content: Those lonely roads on which lovers walk to make a tryst.
auth_sentence.res_content: Those lonely roads on which lovers walk to make a tryst.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Those lonely roads on which lovers walk to make a tryst.

auth_sentence.content: "Holiday-makers' tryst with death," the Times of India had written.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Holiday-makers' tryst with death," the Times of India had written.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Holiday-makers' tryst with death," the Times of India had written.
